meanings.definition: A faint design made in some paper during manufacture, visible when held against the light.
meanings.sent1: The watermarks on the paper showed a delicate pattern when viewed under light.
meanings.sent2: The document had official watermarks to prevent forgery.
meanings.sent3: The detective chuckled as he realized the watermarks on the document revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: Her memories left a watermark on her heart, faint but always present.
meanings.sent5: The watermarks on the ancient map guided the explorer to hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: A distinguishing mark or logo imprinted on paper to prevent counterfeiting.
meanings.sent1: The watermark on the certificate confirmed its authenticity.
meanings.sent2: Banknotes often have watermarks to ensure they are genuine.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about putting silly watermarks on his drawings to confuse art thieves.
meanings.sent4: The company's logo acted as a watermark, signifying quality and trust.
meanings.sent5: The watermark on the ticket glowed under UV light, proving its validity.
